(1) A company incorporated after the commencement of the Companies (Amendment) Act, 2019 and having a share capital shall not commence any business or exercise any borrowing powers unless— (a) a declaration is filed by a director within a period of of the date of incorporation of the company in such form and verified in such manner as may be prescribed, with the Registrar that every subscriber to the memorandum has paid the value of the shares agreed to be taken by him on the date of making of such declaration; and (b) the company has filed with the Registrar a verification of its registered office as provided in sub-section (2) of section 12. act_summary: This section of the Companies Act, 2013 regulates the incorporation and operation of companies by requiring members to pay for their shares within a specified period after incorporation. It also mandates that declarations be filed with the Registrar before commencing business or borrowing powers, ensuring compliance with company laws and penalties for non-compliance.
